research_section.title: Our Aim
research_section.description: The Adsorption and Materials Research Group is dedicated to the development of next-generation materials with enhanced adsorption characteristics for gas separation and catalytic applications. Our research is inherently interdisciplinary, integrating expertise across materials chemistry, surface science, and process engineering, and is strengthened through strategic collaborations with global research institutions and industry partners. Employing cutting-edge experimental platforms alongside advanced computational modeling, we design, synthesize, and characterize materials at the molecular and structural levels. Our objective is to enable sustainable, high-efficiency technologies that address critical environmental and industrial challenges, fostering long-term societal and ecological benefit.

about_section.title: About CSIR-CSMCRI
about_section.description: CSIR-CSMCRI stands for the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research - Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute. This institute is located in Bhavnagar, Gujarat, India. It is one of the constituent laboratories of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), which is an autonomous body under the Government of India.
